name: Normal Pace
description: The standard travel pace that balances speed with awareness. Characters move at a steady, sustainable rate that allows them to cover good distance while maintaining some awareness of their surroundings. This is the default pace for most overland travel and represents a reasonable compromise between speed and caution.

mechanicalEffects: No modifier to Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) checks
Default pace for most travel situations
Sustainable for 8 hours of travel per day without exhaustion risk

restrictions: Cannot be used if terrain limits maximum pace to Slow
Mounts can move at twice the listed distance for 1 hour, after which they need a Short or Long Rest before they can move at that increased pace again

terrain.note: Most terrain types allow Normal pace as the maximum (see Travel Terrain table)
terrain.difficultTerrain: Difficult Terrain halves movement speed, which may reduce effective pace
terrain.roads: Good roads can increase maximum pace from Normal to Fast

calculations.baseFormula: 300 feet per minute, 3 miles per hour, 24 miles per 8-hour day
calculations.specialMovement: For creatures with magical speed, use: (Speed รท 10) ร hours traveled = miles per day
calculations.mountedTravel: Mounts can double the distance for 1 hour before requiring rest

examples: Following a well-marked road or trail
Default pace when no special circumstances apply
